pageContext.claim: “Last month was the third straight month in a row with 60,000 apprehensions on our southern border. Think of that. We apprehended 60,000 people.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump comes up with this figure by including people who are not trying to sneak across the border but present themselves to border authorities and are deemed inadmissible, which Homeland Security defines as: "individuals encountered at ports of entry who are seeking lawful admission into the United States but are determined to be inadmissible, individuals presenting themselves to seek humanitarian protection under our laws; and individuals who withdraw an application for admission and return to their countries of origin within a short timeframe." The monthly figure for apprehensions has averaged 50,000 in recent months. He's also twisting the data to brag about how high the apprehensions are, whereas he used to brag how much they had fallen.
